newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines says has reserves of $11.76 bln.
newsitem.headline: Philippines says has reserves of $11.76 bln.

text.p: The Philippines had gross international reserves amounting to $11.76 billion as of January 27, up from $11.74 billion at the end of December, the presidential palace said on Saturday.
The palace said in a statement that Central Bank Governor Gabriel Singson had informed President Fidel Ramos that the reserves were equivalent to three month's worth of imports of goods and services.
Singson also said the reserves included the country's reserve position in the International Monetary fund.
